conversation.message: Dear School_D Admissions, I’m Student_E. School_D is one of my top choices, and I’m ready to commit if offered a place. I’m especially drawn to School_D’s environment and would be excited to contribute actively to the school community. I would be grateful for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C ranks me 4th (behind Students B, C, D). If I apply there now, I likely get rejected if higher-priority students apply. School_D is my 2nd choice and ranks me 4th as well, but importantly Student_D (who is School_D's top priority) strongly prefers School_B first, so School_D may be less contested in round 1. To maximize my chance of securing a high-ranked option quickly, I will apply to School_D now with a strong, committed message.

conversation.message: Dear Student_E, thank you for your thoughtful application and for your strong interest in School_D. At this time, we’re not able to offer you a place. We appreciate your interest and wish you the very best in your admissions process.
conversation.thought: Student_E is 4th on School_D's true priority list (D, A, C, E, B). With quota 1, accepting E in round 1 risks losing the chance to match with higher-priority students (Student_D, Student_A, Student_C) who may apply later. Given Student_E ranks School_D 2nd (after School_C), they may also be accepted by School_C (which ranks E 4th) or other schools, so rejecting now is less costly than locking in a lower-priority match. No other applicants are in the inbox this round, but optimal strategy is to hold out for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_A and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly value your academic environment and would be committed to enrolling if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me last in its priority list, delaying would only reduce my chances further because higher-priority students (especially Student_E and Student_B) are also likely to apply early. I will still apply now and make a concise, sincere case for fit and commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for sharing that School_B is your first choice. After reviewing applications in this round and given our limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your interest in School_B and wish you the very best in the matching process.
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority ranks Student_A last. In this round I also received an [APPLY] from Student_C, who is ranked higher than Student_A. With quota 1, accepting Student_A now would block the chance to match with higher-priority candidates (Student_E or Student_B may apply later; Student_C is already applying). Therefore I should reject Student_A to preserve capacity for higher-ranked applicants.

conversation.message: School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly want to enroll and would accept an offer immediately. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_B. Given full information, School_B’s priority order is Student_E > Student_B > Student_C > Student_D > Student_A, so I am 3rd. If I apply immediately, I can be accepted unless higher-priority students (E or B) apply and displace me. Early application maximizes my chance to secure my first choice before the seat is taken.

conversation.message:

While I would prefer E or B if they later apply, there is no guarantee they will, and accepting C now secures a relatively high-ranked student (3rd on my list) within capacity. Therefore I should accept Student_C.

conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions, I’m Student_D. School_C is one of my top choices, and I’m very interested in joining your program.
